result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon Bree Boyer

records.addlTxt: Court MODIFIES the contact order to no VIOLENT contact with S.T.O. Order signed and filed.

Defendant Shannon Bree Boyer in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DPA hearing held.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 29.  Review hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shannon Bree Boyer in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

due to the nature of the charge this case is reassigned to Br. 29 Judge Kiefer.

Defendant Shannon Bree Boyer in court by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Cerniglia is in trial, unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Br 29 Judge Kiefer.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.T.O. (DOB 3/23/07)
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Shannon Bree Boyer in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Shannon Bree Boyer in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shannon Bree Boyer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to assignment of Assistant District Attorney, the defendant is advised that case is reassigned to Judge Kiefer Br 29. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
